trans-unit.source: Clean compiler generated ''src'' and ''bin'' directories as well as any empty directories, suppress compilation.
Set default transport protocol (tcp | TCP).
Do not validate hosts in nodepools.
Create an xml-based model of the application (.adl file), but suppress the creation of the application artifacts as well as the build process.
Main composite to use.
Do not imply exlocation constraints from restartable and relocatable configs.
Set profiling. -1: no profiling (default), 0: profile but do not keep samples, >0: profile and keep samples using a reservoir of specified size
Clean all compiler generated files and directories, suppress compilation.
Set the sampling rate for profiling (in [0,1]), the default is 1.
Create a standalone application executable.
Generate optimized code with less runtime error checking.
Build PEs using the source tree -- no installation required.
Clean all compiler generated files and directories, suppress compilation.
Set the size of the default pool.
.spl input file.
Add ''wrapper: sdb'' as a config for the main composite (wrapper config specified in the source file, if any, takes precedence).

Use a specified instance. The default behavior is to use the auto-managed instance ''"+Distillery::getSPLDefaultInstanceShortId()+"'', which is populated using available ''execution'' hosts. The default behavior can be overriden either by this option (-i) or by setting a default instance in the environment via ''source streamsprofile.sh'' (see --help).
Use the specified number of threads for building the binaries (make''s -j parameter).
Put only localhost into the default pool (takes precedence over default pool size setting).
Generate facade tuples when possible.
Generate a default makefile for building the SPL application.
Specify fusion mode, options are NONE - No operator fusion, FALL - Fuse all operators, FRAND - Fuse randomly, FDEF - default fusion, FOPT - Optimized fusion.
trans-unit.note: The terms NONE, FALL, FRAND, FDEF and FOPT are literals that should not be translated

trans-unit.source: Set the number of remote hosts to use for distributed compile using distcc.
Generate statically linked processing elements.

Set toolkit lookup path(s) (separate multiple paths with ''"+string(SPLPATH_SEP)+"''). Each path is a toolkit directory, a directory of toolkit directories, or a toolkitList XML file. Overrides STREAMS_SPLPATH environment variable.
Use network byte order encoding (this should be used in heterogeneous configurations where little and big endian hosts are employed).
Put the compiler into verbose mode.
Pass the specified flags to ld while linking.
Pass the specified flags to the C++ compiler while building.
Generate nicely formatted code (may slow down code generation).
Version of the SPL input.
Print the AST (abstract syntax tree).
Print the compilation unit signature (namespace, operator names, and function signatures).
Print the source code based on the AST (abstract syntax tree).
Print the token stream.
Only perform syntax checking, no type checking or other semantic analysis.
Turn certain error messages into warnings that are caused by incorrect SPL1 -> SPL2 translation.
Translate from SPL 1 to SPL 2.
Dump debugging information.
Ignore toolkit timestamp problems.
Tolerate missing toolkits.

usage: {0} [-h, --help] | -g, --generator <generator> -x, --model <xmlModel> \ -s, --signature <signature> -o, --outfile <outfile> -z, --beautify <configuration>
-h, --help Get (this) usage information -i, --incremental Incrementaly generate the code -g, --generator generator The generator to be run -x, --model xmlModel The file containing the xml model to be code generated -s, --signature signature A type-unique signature to be written into the generated code -o, --outfile outfile The file into which we are generating code -z, --beautify configuration Format the generated code using the provided uncrustify configuration
This module generates code from an XML model.

usage: {0} [-h, --help] | -t, --type <type> <baseName>
-h, --help Get (this) usage information -t, --type type The type we are generating a code generator for. It must be one of: * EnumerationModel * TupleModel * OperatorInstanceModel * PEModel * StandaloneModel * SharedVariableModel * Script -o, --output dir Output directory to use (only used for Script) baseName The name that forms the template when sufffixed with .cgt and the code generator when suffixed with .pm or .pl
This module generates a code generator from a code generator template.

usage: {0} [-h, --help] [-k, --kind <kind>] [-s, --silent] [-i, --directory]
-h, --help Get (this) usage information -k, --kind <kind> Generate templates for a specific operator kind. Options are: 'generic' : A generic mixed-mode C++ operator 'c++' : A non-generic C++ operator 'java' : A non-generic Java operator -s, --silent Create skeletons for missing artifacts without prompting the user -i, --directory Directory containing the operator artifacts
Create code generator modules (<opname>_h.pm and <opname>_cpp.pm) from template files (<opname>_h.cgt and <opname>_cpp.cgt). Offer to create skeleton code generator templates (.cgt files) and a default operator model (.xml file), if they do not already exist.
trans-unit.target:
kullanım: {0} [-h, --help] [-k, --kind <kind>] [-s, --silent] [-i, --directory]
-h, --help Bu kullanım bilgisini göster -n, --kind <kind> Belirtilen operatör tipi için tasarım oluştur 'generiç' : Genel olan birleşik mod C++ operatör 'c++' : Genel olmayan C++ operatör 'java' : Genel olmayan Java operatör -s, --silent Teklif etmeden eksik olan ögeler için iskelet oluştur -i, --directory Operatör ögelerini barındıran dizin
Kod üretim modüllerini (<opname>_h.pm ve <opname>_cpp.pm) taslak dosyalarını (<opname>_h.cgt ve <opname>_cpp.cgt) kullanarak oluştur. Kod üretim taslaklarının (.cgt dosyaları) ve operatör tasarımının (.xml dosyası) bulunamaması durumunda, taslak iskeletlerini ve varsayılan tasarımı oluştur.

trans-unit.source:
usage: {0} [-h, --help] | -f, --file <file>
-h, --help Get (this) usage information -f, --file <file> .dps or .dmm file
Translates from a .dps or .dmm SPL v1 file to a .spl SPL 2 file.
trans-unit.target:
kullanım: {0} [-h, --help] | -f, --file <dosya>
-h, --help Bu kullanım bilgisini göster -f, --file <dosya> .dps veya .dmm dosyası
SPL v1 .dps veya .dmm dosyasından SPL 2 .dps dosyasına çeviri yap.

trans-unit.source:
usage: {0} [-h, --help] | -f, --file <file>
-h, --help Get (this) usage information -f, --file <file> Operator model .xml file
Check if the operator model .xml file is well-formed and valid.
trans-unit.target:
kullanım: {0} [-h, --help] | -f, --file <dosya>
-h, --help Bu kullanım bilgisini göster -f, --file <dosya> Operatör tasarımı .xml dosyası
Operatör tasarımının biçimli ve geçerli olduğunu kontrol et.

trans-unit.source:
usage: {0} [-h, --help] | -f, --file <file>
-h, --help Get (this) usage information -f, --file <file> Function model .xml file Check if the function model .xml file is well-formed and valid.
trans-unit.target:
kullanım: {0} [-h, --help] | -f, --file <dosya>
-h, --help Bu kullanım bilgisini göster -f, --file <dosya> Fonksiyon tasarımı .xml dosyası Fonksiyon tasarımının biçimli ve geçerli olduğunu kontrol et.
